section.title: MEDICATIONS ADMINISTERED DURING VISIT
section.text: Data in this section may be excluded or not available.

tr.td: Get a Chest X-ray done on 6/23/2015 showing the Lower Respiratory Tract Structure.
Plan for Clindamycin 300mg , RxNorm code – 748747, TID, if pain does not subside by the end of the day.
Plan to get admitted to Community Health Hospitals Inpatient facility if fever does not subside within a day. (Date: 6/23/2015)
After treatment, schedule visit with Neighborhood Physicians Practice on 7/1/2015.

tr.td: TDr Albert Davis diagnosed Ms Alice Newman to be suffering from Fever and suspected Pneumonia and recommended admission to the Community Health Hospitals

td.paragraph: Dr Henry Seven has successfully discharged Ms Alice Newman and has advised her to follow the diet recommendations.
The patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated Ms Newman for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals.
Ms Newman recovered from Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition.
If there is fever greater than 101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency.

item.paragraph: Ms Alice Newman seems to be developing high fever and hence we recommend her to get admitted to a nearby hospital using the provided referral.

section.title: Pathology study
section.text: A pathologist is a physician specializing in the diagnosis of disease based on examination of tissues and fluids removed from the body.

act.text: A pathologist is a physician specializing in the diagnosis of disease based on examination of tissues and fluids removed from the body.
